head.citation-title: Path tracking controller design and simulation for the lunar lander demonstrator
head.abstracts: In Korea, a lunar exploration program has been prepared with the aim of launching a lunar module in the 2020's. As part of it, a lunar lander demonstrator has been developed to verify the structure, propulsion, and control system before launching a lunar module to the deep space. After verifying the system, the demonstrator will be evaluated by the flight test. This paper deals with the path tracking controller based on thrusters for the demonstrator. For this, we first derive equations of motion considering the allocation of the thrusters and design the path tracking controller based on quaternion. The signal generated from the controller is continuous so PWPF(Pulse-Width Pulse-Frequency) modulator is adopted for generating on/off signal. For altitude and attitude determination, we use the Kalman filter assuming the sensors have only noise. Finally MATLAB simulation is performed for evaluating the path tracking ability and the final landing velocity. © 2012 by Korea Aerospace Research Institute.
